intro: Ampelocera cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped white flowers. The plant produces a bulbous stem that stores nutrients, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. It typically blooms in spring and is adapted to coastal and sandy soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in tropical and subtropical regions.
